thread.title: Former Wylie star Nikita Whitlock keeps getting larger role with New York Giants
thread.title_full: Former Wylie star Nikita Whitlock keeps getting larger role with New York Giants | Dallas Morning News

author: Matt Wixon
title: Former Wylie star Nikita Whitlock keeps getting larger role with New York Giants
text:
I wrote last month about former Wylie star Nikita Whitlock's long journey to the NFL , where he's now a member of the New York Giants.
He was a long shot to make the roster, or so it seemed in camp, but now his role keeps getting bigger. He's the Giants' starting fullback, he's a valuable special teams player and he's now the team's late-game defensive weapon.
What does that mean?
The Giants are using Whitlock as a pass-rushing defensive tackle. He's small for a defensive tackle, at only 5-10 and 245 pounds, but he can use his quickness and incredible strength to get to the quarterback. Entering Monday night's game against the 49ers, Whitlock had a sack, a quarterback hit and a hurry in 18 snaps as a defensive tackle.
These details come from this story in NJ.com, which includes this Quote: from Giants center Weston Richburg:
"I've never [blocked him] and I hope I never have to do it. I feel so bad for those guys who have to block that guy. He's a mismatch when he gets in there, especially at the end of games when guys are tired."
Anyone who watched Wylie play back in 2007 and 2008 -- Whitlock helped the Pirates get to the 5A Division II title game in 2008 -- remembers how Whitlock was a mismatch.
